verses.text: My slave Moses is not so, who is faithful in all my house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him I will speak mouth to mouth and by sight not by enigmas; he shall see the similitude of the LORD. Why then were ye not afraid to speak against my slave Moses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the anger of the LORD was kindled against them, and he departed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cloud departed from off the tabernacle, and, behold, Miriam was leprous as the snow; and Aaron looked upon Miriam, and, behold, she was leprous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron said unto Moses, Alas, my lord, I beseech thee, lay not the sin upon us, in which we have done foolishly, and we have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let her not be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed when he comes out of his mother’s womb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses cried unto the LORD, saying, Heal her now, O God, I beseech thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, If her father had but spit in her face, should she not be ashamed seven days? Let her be shut out from the camp seven days, and after that let her be received in again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Miriam was shut out from the camp seven days, and the people did not journey until Miriam was brought in again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And afterward he moved the people from Hazeroth, and they pitched camp in the wilderness of Paran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send thou men that they may spy out the land of Canaan, which I give unto the sons of Israel; of every tribe of their fathers ye shall send a man, each one a prince among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses by the commandment of the LORD sent them from the wilderness of Paran; all those men were princes of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these were their names: of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua, the son of Zaccur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat, the son of Hori.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal, the son of Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hosea, the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti, the son of Raphu.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel, the son of Sodi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Joseph, namely, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi, the son of Susi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel, the son of Gemalli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur, the son of Michael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi, the son of Vophsi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Gad, Geuel, the son of Machi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to spy out the land. And Moses called Hosea, the son of Nun, Joshua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan and said unto them, Go up this way towards the Negev and go up into the mountain
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and see the land, what it is, and the people that dwell therein, whether they are strong or weak, few or many,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and how the land is that they dwell in, whether it is good or bad, and what cities there are that they dwell in, whether in tents, or in strong holds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what the land is, whether it is fertile or sterile, whether there are trees therein, or not. And be ye of good courage and bring of the fruit of the land. Now the time was the time of the firstripe grapes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they went up and spied out the land from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob, as men come to Hamath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they ascended by the Negev and came unto Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the sons of Anak, were. (Now Hebron was built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came unto the brook of Eshcol, and from there they cut down a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they bore it between two upon a staff; and they brought of the pomegranates and of the figs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The place was called the brook Eshcol because of the cluster of grapes which the sons of Israel cut down from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they returned from searching of the land after forty days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went and came to Moses and to Aaron and to all the congregation of the sons of Israel, unto the wilderness of Paran to Kadesh and brought back word unto them and unto all the congregation and showed them the fruit of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they told him and said, We came unto the land where thou didst send us, and surely it flows with milk and honey; and this is the fruit of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless the people are strong that dwell in that land, and the cities are very great and strong; and moreover we saw the sons of Anak there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amalek dwells in the land of the Negev, and the Hittite and the Jebusite and the Amorite dwell in the mountains, and the Canaanite dwells by the sea and by the side of the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Caleb stilled the people before Moses, and said, Let us go up at once and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the men that went up with him said, We are not able to go up against that people, for they are stronger than we.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought up an evil report of the land which they had spied out unto the sons of Israel, saying, The land, through which we have gone through to spy it out, is a land that eats up its inhabitants; and all the people that we saw in it are men of a great stature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there we saw giants, the sons of Anak, of the race of the giants; and we were in our own sight as locusts, and so we were in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the congregation lifted up their voice and cried, and the people wept that night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the sons of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, and the whole congregation said unto them, Oh, that we might die in the land of Egypt or that we might die in this wilderness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why has the LORD brought us unto this land, to fall by the sword, that our wives and our children should be a prey? Would it not be better for us to return into Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they said one to another, Let us make a captain, and let us return into Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembly of the congregation of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Joshua, the son of Nun, and Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, who were of those that had spied out the land, rent their clothes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they spoke unto all the company of the sons of Israel, saying, The land which we passed through to spy out is an exceeding good land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the LORD delights in us, then he will bring us into this land and give it to us, a land which flows with milk and honey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, do not be rebels against the LORD, neither fear ye the people of the land, for they are our bread; their defence is departed from them, and the LORD is with us; do not fear them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the multitude spoke of stoning them with stones. But the glory of the LORD appeared in the tabernacle of the testimony before all the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, How long will this people provoke me? How long will it be before they believe me, with all the signs which I have done among them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will smite them with the pestilence and disinherit them and will make of thee a greater nation and mightier than they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto the LORD, Then the Egyptians shall hear it, for thou didst bring this people out of the midst of them with thy might;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the inhabitants of this land will say, for they have already heard that thou, oh LORD, wast among this people, that thou, O LORD, art seen face to face, and that thy cloud was over them, and that thou didst go before them by day time in a pillar of a cloud and in a pillar of fire by night;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that thou hast caused all this people to die as one man; and the Gentiles who have heard of thy fame will speak, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because the LORD was not able to bring this people into the land which he swore unto them; therefore, he has slain them in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my Lord be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD is longsuffering and of great mercy, letting go of iniquity and transgression and absolving, but by no means absolving the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the sons unto the third and fourth generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pardon now the iniquity of this people according to the greatness of thy mercy and as thou hast forgiven this people from Egypt even until now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the LORD said, I have pardoned according to thy word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as truly as I live, all the earth shall be filled with the glory of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because all those men who saw my glory and my signs which I have done in Egypt and in the wilderness and have tempted me now these ten times and have not hearkened to my voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: surely they shall not see the land which I swore unto their fathers, neither shall any of those that provoked me see it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But my slave Caleb, because there was another spirit in him, and he proved to follow after me, I will bring him into the land that he entered into, and his seed shall receive it by inheritance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and even the Amalekite and the Canaanite who dwell in the valley. Turn around tomorrow and go into the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How long shall I hear this evil congregation, which murmurs against me, the complaints of the sons of Israel, which they murmur against me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say unto them, As truly as I live, saith the LORD, according as ye have spoken in my ears, so will I do to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your carcasses shall fall in this wilderness, all that were numbered of you, according to your whole number, from twenty years old and upward, who have murmured against me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: doubtless ye shall not come into the land, concerning which I swore to make you dwell therein, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But your little ones, whom ye said should be a prey, I will bring them in, and they shall know the land which ye have despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, your carcasses, they shall fall in this wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And your children shall be shepherded in the wilderness forty years and bear your fornications until your carcasses are wasted in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the number of the days in which ye spied out the land, even forty days, each day for a year, ye shall bear your iniquities forty years, and ye shall know my reason for annulling my promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, the LORD, have spoken, I will surely do it unto all this evil congregation that are gathered together against me; in this wilderness they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the men, whom Moses had sent to spy out the land, who returned and made all the congregation to murmur against him by bringing up a slander upon the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even those men that brought an evil report of the land, died by the plague before the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joshua, the son of Nun, and Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, remained alive of the men that went to spy out the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses told these things unto all the sons of Israel, and the people mourned greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they rose up early in the morning and climbed up into the top of the mountain, saying, Here we are prepared to go up unto the place of which the LORD has spoken; for we have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Why do ye break the commandment of the LORD? This also shall not prosper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not go up, for the LORD is not among you; do not be smitten before your enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Amalekite and the Canaanite are there before you, and ye shall fall by the sword; because ye are turned away from following the LORD, therefore, the LORD will not be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they presumed to go up unto the hill top; nevertheless, the ark of the covenant of the LORD and Moses, did not depart out of the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Amalekite came down and the Canaanite who dwelt in that hill and smote them and defeated them, pursuing them unto Hormah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the sons of Israel and say unto them, When you have entered into the land of your habitations, which I give unto you
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will make an offering on fire unto the LORD, a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to offer a vow or of your free will or to make in your solemn feasts an acceptable savour unto the LORD, of the cows, or of the sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he that offers his offering unto the LORD shall bring a present of a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of a hin of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of wine for a drink offering shalt thou offer the fourth part of a hin in addition to the burnt offering or the sacrifice, for each lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for each ram, thou shalt prepare as a present two tenth deals of flour mingled with the third part of a hin of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of wine for a drink offering thou shalt offer the third part of a hin, for an acceptable savour unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt offering or for a sacrifice, to offer a vow or a sacrifice of peace unto the LORD,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thou shalt offer with the bullock a present of three tenth deals of flour mingled with half of a hin of oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of wine for a drink offering thou shalt offer half of a hin, for an offering on fire, of an acceptable savour unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus shall it be done for each bullock or for each ram or for each lamb, the same for sheep as for goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the number that ye shall prepare, so shall ye do to each one according to their number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that are natural born shall do these things after this manner, to offer an offering on fire, of an acceptable savour unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when a stranger sojourns with you or whoever is among you, for your ages, if they will offer an offering on fire of an acceptable savour unto the LORD; as ye do, so he shall do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One statute shall be both for you of the congregation and also for the stranger that sojourns with you, a perpetual statute, for your ages; as ye are, so shall the stranger be before the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One same law and the same right shall be for you and for the stranger that sojourns with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD also spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the sons of Israel and say unto them, When ye have come into the land where I bring you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it shall be that when ye begin to eat of the bread of the land, ye shall offer up an offering unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall offer up a cake of the first of your dough for an offering; as the offering of the threshingfloor, so shall ye offer it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the firstfruits of your dough ye shall give unto the LORD an offering in your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when ye err and do not observe all these commandments which the LORD has spoken unto Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even all that the LORD has commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the day that the LORD commanded Moses and from then on, for your ages,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then it shall be, if the sin was committed by ignorance without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one young bullock as a burnt offering, for an acceptable savour unto the LORD with its present and its drink offering, according to the law, and one he goat as the sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall reconcile all the congregation of the sons of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them, for it is ignorance; and they shall bring their offering, an offering on fire unto the LORD and their sins before the LORD which they committed in their ignorance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be forgiven all the congregation of the sons of Israel and the stranger that sojourns among them, seeing all the people were in ignorance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if any person sins through ignorance, then he shall bring a she goat of the first year as the sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall reconcile the soul that errs ignorantly, when he sins by ignorance before the LORD, he shall be reconciled; and it shall be forgiven him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall have the same law for the one that sins through ignorance, both for the natural born among the sons of Israel and for the stranger that sojourns among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person that does something consciously, whether they are natural born or a stranger, the same reproaches the LORD; and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he has despised the word of the LORD and has made void his commandment, that person shall utterly be cut off; his iniquity shall be upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And while the sons of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man that gathered firewood upon the sabbath day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those that found him gathering firewood brought him unto Moses and Aaron and unto all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they put him in ward because it was not declared what should be done to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, The man shall be surely put to death; all the congregation shall stone him with stones outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the congregation brought him outside the camp and stoned him with stones, and he died, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the sons of Israel and bid them that they make for themselves fringes in the borders of their garments throughout their generations and that they put upon the fringe of the borders a ribband of blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be unto you for a fringe that ye may look upon it and remember all the commandments of the LORD and do them and that ye seek not after your own heart and your own eyes, seeking after which ye fornicate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That ye may remember, and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God. I AM your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Peleth, of the sons of Reuben, took men;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they rose up against Moses, with two hundred and fifty men of the sons of Israel, princes of the congregation, of the council, men of renown;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron and said unto them, We have had enough of you, seeing all the congregation are holy, every one of them, and the LORD is among them; why then lift ye up yourselves above the congregation of the LORD?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Moses heard it, he fell upon his face;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he spoke unto Korah and unto all his company, saying, Tomorrow the LORD will show who are his and who is holy and will cause the one who is holy to come near unto him; the one whom he has chosen he will cause to come near unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do this: Take censers, Korah, and all his company,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and put fire in them and put incense in them before the LORD tomorrow; and it shall be that the man whom the LORD chooses, he shall be holy; this shall be enough for you, ye sons of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Korah, Hear, I pray you, ye sons of Levi:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Does it seem but a small thing unto you that the God of Israel has separated you from the congregation of Israel, to bring you near to himself to minister in the service of the tabernacle of the LORD and to stand before the congregation to minister unto them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And that he has brought thee near to him and all thy brethren the sons of Levi with thee, and ye seek the priesthood also?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For which cause both thou and all thy company are gathered together against the LORD, for what is Aaron, that ye murmur against him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, but they replied, We will not come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it a small thing that thou hast brought us up out of a land that flowed with milk and honey to make us die in the wilderness, but thou must also make thyself lord to rule over us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, thou hast not brought us into a land that flows with milk and honey or given us inheritance of fields and vineyards; wilt thou put out the eyes of these men? We will not come up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses was very angry and said unto the LORD, Look not thou upon their offering; I have not taken so much as one ass from them, neither have I done evil to any of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Korah, Be thou and all thy company before the LORD, thou and they and Aaron, tomorrow;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and let each man take his censer and put incense in them and let each man bring his censer before the LORD, two hundred and fifty censers; thou also and Aaron, each of you with his censer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And each man took his censer and put fire in them and laid incense in them and stood in the door of the tabernacle of the testimony with Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Korah had gathered all the congregation against them unto the door of the tabernacle of the testimony; then the glory of the LORD appeared unto all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Separate yourselves from among this congregation, and I will consume them in a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they fell upon their faces and said, O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, shall one man sin and wilt thou be wroth with all the congregation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the congregation, saying, Separate yourselves now from the tent of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses rose up and went unto Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel followed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he spoke unto the congregation, saying, Depart from the tents of these wicked men and touch nothing of theirs lest peradventure ye be consumed in all their sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they removed themselves from the tents of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side; and Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood in the door of their tents, with their wives and their sons and their little children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said, Hereby ye shall know that the LORD has sent me to do all these works, for I have not done them out of my own heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If these men die the common death of all men or if they are visited after the visitation of all men, then the LORD has not sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the LORD does a new thing and the earth opens her mouth and swallows them up with all their things and they go down alive into Sheol, then ye shall know that these men have provoked the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass as he had made an end of speaking all these words that the ground broke open under them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the earth opened her mouth and swallowed them up, and their houses and all the men of Korah and all their goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They and all that they had went down alive into Sheol, and the earth closed upon them, and they perished from among the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all Israel, those that were round about them, fled at the cry of them, for they said, Lest the earth swallow us up also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And fire came out from the LORD and consumed the two hundred and fifty men that offered incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, that he take up the censers out of the burning and scatter thou the fire yonder, for
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the censers of these sinners are sanctified against their own souls, and broad plates shall be made of them for a covering of the altar, for they offered with them before the LORD; therefore, they are sanctified, and they shall be a sign unto the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar, the priest, took the brass censers with which those that were burnt had offered, and they were made into a broad covering of the altar
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be a memorial unto the sons of Israel, that no stranger who is not of the seed of Aaron come near to offer incense before the LORD, that he not be as Korah and as his company, as the LORD said to him by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the next day all the congregation of the sons of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, saying, Ye have killed the people of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass when the congregation was gathered against Moses and against Aaron that they looked toward the tabernacle of the testimony; and, behold, the cloud had covered it, and the glory of the LORD appeared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron came before the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Depart from among this congregation, and I will consume them in a moment. And they fell upon their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto Aaron, Take the censer and put fire in it from off the altar and put incense upon it and go quickly unto the congregation and reconcile them; for the wrath has gone out from before the face of the LORD; the plague is begun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Aaron took his censer as Moses said and ran into the midst of the congregation; and, behold, the plague was begun among the people; and he put on incense and reconciled the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he stood between the dead and the living; and the plague was stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now those that died in that plague were fourteen thousand seven hundred, besides those that died concerning the matter of Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron returned unto Moses unto the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, when the plague was stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the sons of Israel and take of each of them a rod according to the houses of their fathers, of all their princes, twelve rods according to the houses of their fathers, and write thou each man’s name upon his rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt write Aaron’s name upon the rod of Levi, for each head of family of their fathers shall have one rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt lay them up in the tabernacle of the testimony, before the testimony, where I will testify of myself unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass regarding the man whom I shall choose that his rod shall blossom; and I will resolve the complaints of the sons of Israel, with which they murmur against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses spoke unto the sons of Israel, and all their princes gave him a rod apiece, for each prince one, according to their fathers’ houses, even twelve rods; and the rod of Aaron was among their rods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses laid up the rods before the LORD in the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass that on the next day Moses went into the tabernacle of the testimony; and, behold, the rod of Aaron of the house of Levi had budded and blossomed and brought forth open flowers and yielded almonds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses brought out all the rods from before the LORD unto all the sons of Israel; and they looked, and each one took his rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Return Aaron’s rod before the testimony to be kept for a sign unto the rebellious sons; and thou shalt cause their complaints to cease from upon me, that they not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses did as the LORD commanded him, so did he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the sons of Israel spoke unto Moses, saying, Behold, we are dead, we are lost, we are all lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who comes near unto the tabernacle of the LORD shall die; shall we all perish?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Aaron, Thou and thy sons and thy father’s house with thee shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary; and thou and thy sons with thee shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thy brethren also of the tribe of Levi, the tribe of thy father, bring thou with thee, that they may be joined unto thee and serve thee; but thou and thy sons with thee shall serve before the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall keep thy charge, and the charge of all the tabernacle; only they shall not come near the holy vessels or the altar, that neither they, nor ye also, die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall join themselves unto thee and keep the charge of the tabernacle of the testimony in all the service of the tabernacle; and no stranger shall come near unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall have the charge of the sanctuary and the charge of the altar, that there be no more wrath upon the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, I have taken your brethren the Levites from among the sons of Israel, given unto you as a gift of the LORD, to serve in the ministry of the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thou and thy sons with thee shall keep your priesthood for every thing of the altar and within the veil, and ye shall minister; for I have given the service of your priesthood as a gift, and the stranger that comes near shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The LORD spoke further unto Aaron, Behold, I also have given thee the charge of my offerings; all the dedicated things of the sons of Israel I have given unto thee by reason of the anointing, and to thy sons, by a perpetual statute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be thine of the holy things, reserved from the fire: every offering of theirs, every present of theirs, and every offering that represents their sin, and every offering that represents their guilt, which they shall render unto me, shall be most holy for thee and for thy sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the sanctuary shalt thou eat it; every male shall eat it; it shall be holy unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This also shall be thine: the heave offering of their gifts. All the wave offerings of the sons of Israel, I have given them unto thee and to thy sons and to thy daughters with thee, by a statute for ever; everyone that is clean in thy house shall eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the best of the oil and all the best of the wine and of the wheat, the firstfruits of this, which they shall present unto the LORD, this have I given thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The firstfruits of theirs of all the things of the land, which they shall bring unto the LORD, shall be thine; everyone that is clean in thy house shall eat of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every anathema in Israel shall be thine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every thing that opens the womb in all flesh, which they shall offer unto the LORD, whether it is of men or animals, shall be thine; nevertheless the firstborn of man shalt thou surely ransom, and the firstborn of unclean animals shalt thou ransom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from a month old shalt thou effect their ransom, a ransom according to thine estimation, for the price of five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenty gerahs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the firstborn of a cow, or the firstborn of a sheep, or the firstborn of a goat, thou shalt not ransom; they are sanctified; thou shalt sprinkle their blood upon the altar and shalt burn their fat for an offering on fire, for an acceptable savour unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the flesh shall be thine, as the wave breast and as the right shoulder shall be thine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the heave offerings of the holy things, which the sons of Israel offer unto the LORD, I have given for thee and for thy sons and for thy daughters with thee, by a perpetual statute; it is a covenant of salt for ever before the LORD for thee and for thy seed with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Aaron, Thou shalt have no inheritance in their land, neither shalt thou have any part among them. I am thy part and thine inheritance among the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, behold, I have given the sons of Levi all the tithes in Israel for an inheritance, for their ministry because they serve in the ministry of the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Neither must the sons of Israel from now on come near the tabernacle of the testimony lest they bear sin and die because of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites shall do the service of the tabernacle of the testimony, and they shall bear their iniquity by a perpetual statute throughout your ages, and they shall not possess an inheritance among the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto the Levites I have given the tithes of the sons of Israel as inheritance, which they shall offer unto the LORD as offerings; therefore, I have said unto them, Among the sons of Israel they shall possess no inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus shalt thou speak unto the Levites and say unto them, When ye take the tithes from the sons of Israel which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then ye shall present a tithe of the tithes as an offering unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall count your offering as though it were the grain of the threshingfloor and as the fullness of the winepress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus ye also shall offer an offering unto the LORD of all your tithes, which ye shall have received of the sons of Israel; and ye shall give of them an offering unto the LORD, to Aaron the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of all your gifts ye shall offer every offering unto the LORD, of all the best thereof ye shall offer the portion that is to be dedicated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thou shalt say unto them, When ye offer the best thereof from it, then it shall be counted unto the Levites as the fruit of the threshingfloor and as the fruit of the winepress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall eat it in any place, ye and your family; for it is your reward for your ministry in the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall bear no sin by reason of it, when ye have offered from it the best of it; and ye shall not pollute the holy things of the sons of Israel, and ye shall not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Aaron, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the ordinance of the law which the LORD has commanded, saying, Speak unto the sons of Israel that they bring thee a red heifer, perfect, in which there is no blemish, and upon which there has never been placed a yoke;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye shall give her unto Eleazar, the priest, that he may bring her forth outside the camp, and he shall cause her to be slain in his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar, the priest, shall take of her blood with his finger and sprinkle of her blood directly before the tabernacle of the testimony seven times;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall cause the heifer to be burnt in his sight; her skin and her flesh and her blood with her dung shall he cause to burn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest shall take cedar wood and hyssop and scarlet and cast it into the midst of the burning of the heifer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the priest shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp, and the priest shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise he that burns her shall wash his clothes in water and bathe his flesh in water and shall be unclean until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a man that is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer and lay them up outside the camp in a clean place, and it shall be kept for the congregation of the sons of Israel for the water of separation; it is sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he that gathers the ashes of the heifer shall wash his clothes and be unclean until the evening; and it shall be unto the sons of Israel and unto the stranger that sojourns among them for a perpetual statute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He that touches the dead body of any human person shall be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall remove the sin from themselves with that water on the third day, and on the seventh day they shall be clean; but if they do not remove the sin from themselves the third day, then the seventh day they shall not be clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever touches the dead body of anyone that is dead and does not remove the sin has defiled the tabernacle of the LORD; and that person shall be cut off from Israel; because the water of separation was not sprinkled upon him, he shall be unclean, and his uncleanness shall be upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law when anyone dies in a tent; all that come into the tent and all that are in the tent shall be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every open vessel which has no lid fastened upon it shall be unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whoever touches one that is slain with a sword in the open fields or a dead body or a human bone or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the unclean person they shall take of the dust of the heifer that was burnt as sin and put living water over it in a vessel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a clean person shall take hyssop and dip it in the water and sprinkle it upon the tent and upon all the stuff and upon the persons that were there and upon the one that touched the bone or the one slain or the one dead or the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the clean person shall sprinkle upon the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day; and when he has removed the sin from them the seventh day, he shall then wash his clothes and bathe himself in water and shall be clean in the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man that shall be unclean and shall not cause the sin to be removed from himself, that person shall be cut off from among the congregation because he has defiled the tabernacle of the LORD; the water of separation has not been sprinkled upon him; he is unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be a perpetual statute unto them, also he that sprinkles the water of separation shall wash his clothes; and he that touches the water of separation shall be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever the unclean person touches shall be unclean; and the person that touches it shall be unclean until evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the sons of Israel, even the whole congregation, into the desert of Zin in the first month; and the people abode in Kadesh; and Miriam died there and was buried there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was no water for the congregation; and they gathered themselves together against Moses and against Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people contended with Moses and spoke, saying, Oh, that we had died when our brethren died before the LORD!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why have ye caused the congregation of the LORD to come into this wilderness that we and our beasts should die here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And why have ye made us to come up out of Egypt to bring us in unto this evil place? It is not a place to plant seed or of figs or of vines or of pomegranates; there is not even any water to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the congregation unto the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, and they fell upon their faces; and the glory of the LORD appeared upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the rod and gather the congregation together, thou and Aaron, thy brother, and speak ye unto the rock before their eyes, and it shall give forth its water, and thou shalt bring forth to them water out of the rock; so thou shalt give the congregation and their beasts drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses took the rod from before the LORD as he commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Aaron gathered the congregation together before the rock, and he said unto them, Hear now, ye rebels; must we fetch you water out of this rock?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses lifted up his hand, and with his rod he smote the rock twice; and the water came out abundantly, and the congregation drank, and their beasts also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and Aaron, Because ye believed me not, to sanctify me in the eyes of the sons of Israel, therefore, ye shall not bring this congregation into the land which I have given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the waters of Meribah; over which the sons of Israel strove with the LORD, and he was sanctified in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent ambassadors from Kadesh unto the king of Edom, Thus saith thy brother Israel, Thou knowest all the travail that has befallen us:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how our fathers went down into Egypt, and we were in Egypt a long time; and the Egyptians mistreated us and our fathers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we cried unto the LORD, who heard our voice, and sent an angel and has brought us forth out of Egypt; and, behold, we are in Kadesh, a city on the edge of thy border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us pass, I pray thee, through thy country; we will not pass through the fields or through the vineyards, neither will we drink of the water of the wells; we will go by the king’s high way, we will not turn to the right hand nor to the left until we have passed thy borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Edom replied unto him, Thou shalt not pass by me lest I come out against thee with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel said unto him, We will go by the high way; and if I and my cattle drink of thy water, then I will pay for it; I will only, without doing anything else, go through on my feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said, Thou shalt not go through. And Edom came out against him with many people and with a strong hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Edom refused to give Israel passage through his border; and thus Israel turned away from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel, even the whole congregation, journeyed from Kadesh, and came unto Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor, on the borders of the land of Edom, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall be gathered unto his peoples; for he shall not enter into the land which I have given unto the sons of Israel because ye were rebels to my word at the water of Meribah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take Aaron and Eleazar, his son, and bring them up unto Mount Hor
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cause Aaron to be stripped of his garments and put them upon Eleazar, his son; for Aaron shall be gathered unto his people and shall die there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses did as the LORD commanded him; and they went up into Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses caused Aaron to be stripped of his garments and put them upon Eleazar, his son; and Aaron died there in the top of the mount; and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they mourned for Aaron thirty days, even all the families of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when King Arad, the Canaanite, who dwelt toward the Negev, heard tell that Israel came by the way of the sentinels; then he fought against Israel and took some of them prisoners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel vowed a vow unto the LORD and said, If thou wilt indeed deliver this people into my hand, then I will utterly destroy their cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD hearkened to the voice of Israel and delivered up the Canaanite; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities, and he called the name of the place Hormah. {Heb. destruction}
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they journeyed from Mount Hor by the way of the Red Sea, to go around the land of Edom, and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people spoke against God and against Moses, Why have ye brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? There is no bread, neither is there any water; and our soul loathes this light bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people; and many people of Israel died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people came to Moses and said, We have sinned, for we have spoken against the LORD and against thee; pray unto the LORD that he take away these serpents from among us. And Moses prayed for the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Make thee a fiery serpent and lift it up as a banner, and it shall be that anyone that is bitten and looks upon it shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses made a serpent of brass and put it up as a banner, and it came to pass that when a serpent bit anyone, he beheld the serpent of brass, and lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel set forward and pitched camp in Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they journeyed from Oboth and pitched at Ijeabarim, in the wilderness which is before Moab, toward the rising of the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From there they removed and pitched in the valley of Zared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From thence they removed and pitched on the other side of Arnon, which is in the wilderness that comes out of the borders of the Amorite; for Arnon is the border of Moab between Moab and the Amorite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore it is said in the book of the battles of the LORD, What he did in the Red Sea, and in the brooks of Arnon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and at the stream of the brooks that goes down to the dwelling of Ar, and lies upon the border of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from there they went to Beer; this is the well of which the LORD spoke unto Moses, Gather the people together, and I will give them water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Israel sang this song, Spring up, O well; sing ye unto it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The princes dug the well, the willing people dug it, and the lawgiver, with their staves. And from the wilderness they went to Mattanah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from Bamoth in the valley, that is in the fields of Moab, to the top of Pisgah, which looks toward Jeshimon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel sent messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let me pass through thy land; we will not turn into the fields or into the vineyards; we will not drink of the waters of the wells; but we will go along by the king’s high way until we are past thy borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Sihon would not allow Israel to pass through his border; instead Sihon gathered all his people together and went out against Israel into the wilderness; and he came to Jahaz and fought against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel smote him with the edge of the sword and possessed his land from Arnon unto Jabbok, even unto the sons of Ammon, for the border of the sons of Ammon was strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel took all these cities; and Israel dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites in Heshbon and in all the villages thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Heshbon was the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and taken out of his hand all his land unto Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore those that speak in proverbs say, Come into Heshbon, let the city of Sihon be built and prepared;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for there is a fire gone out of Heshbon, a flame from the city of Sihon; it has consumed Ar of Moab and the lords of the high places of Arnon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Woe to thee, Moab! thou art undone, O people of Chemosh; he has put thy sons to flight and thy daughters into captivity because of Sihon king of the Amorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Heshbon destroyed their kingdom even unto Dibon, and we have laid them waste even unto Nophah and Medeba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent to spy out Jaazer, and they took the villages thereof and drove out the Amorite that was there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they turned and went up by the way of Bashan; and Og, the king of Bashan, went out against them, he and all his people, to the battle at Edrei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the LORD said unto Moses, Fear him not, for I have delivered him into thy hand and all his people and his land; and thou shalt do to him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they smote him and his sons and all his people until there was none left him alive; and they possessed his land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel set forward and pitched in the plains of Moab on this side Jordan in front of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak, the son of Zippor, saw all that Israel had done to the Amorite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moab was sore afraid of the people because they were many; and Moab was distressed because of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moab said unto the elders of Midian, Now shall this company lick up all that are round about us, as the ox licks up the herbs of the field. And Balak, the son of Zippor, was king of the Moabites at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he sent messengers unto Balaam, the son of Beor, to Pethor, which is by the river Eufrates in the land of the sons of his people, to call him, saying, Behold, there is a people come out from Egypt; behold, they cover the face of the earth, and they abide over against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Come now therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people, for they are too mighty for me; peradventure I shall be able to smite them and drive them out of the land; for I know that he whom thou blessest shall be blessed, and he whom thou cursest shall be cursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the incantations in their hand; and they came unto Balaam and spoke unto him the words of Balak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said unto them, Lodge here this night, and I will recite the words unto you when the LORD shall speak unto me. So the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came unto Balaam and said, Who are these men with thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said unto God, Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab, has sent unto me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, this people that has come out of Egypt, covers the face of the earth; come now, curse me them; peradventure I shall be able to overcome them and drive them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God said unto Balaam, Thou shalt not go with them; neither shalt thou curse the people; for they are blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam rose up in the morning and said unto the princes of Balak, Go back to your land; for the LORD refuses to give me leave to go with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the princes of Moab rose up, and they went unto Balak and said, Balaam refused to come with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak sent yet again princes, more and more honourable than those.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they came to Balaam and said to him, Thus saith Balak, the son of Zippor, Let nothing, I pray thee, hinder thee from coming unto me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I will without a doubt honour thee greatly, and I will do whatever thou sayest unto me; come therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam answered and said unto the slaves of Balak, If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the word of the LORD my God, to do anything small or great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, I pray you, tarry ye also here this night that I may know what the LORD will say unto me again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God came unto Balaam at night and said unto him, If the men come to call thee, rise up, and go with them; but yet the word which I shall say unto thee, that shalt thou do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Balaam rose up in the morning and saddled his female ass and went with the princes of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God’s anger was kindled because he went, and the angel of the LORD stood in the way as an adversary against him. Now he was riding upon his ass, and his two servants were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ass saw the angel of the LORD standing in the way with his sword drawn in his hand; and the ass turned aside out of the way and went into the field. Then Balaam smote the ass to turn her into the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the angel of the LORD stood in a path of the vineyards, a wall being on this side and a wall on that side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ass saw the angel of the LORD, she thrust herself unto the wall and crushed Balaam’s foot against the wall; and he smote her again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the LORD went further and stood in a narrow place, where was no way to turn either to the right hand or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the ass saw the angel of the LORD, she fell down under Balaam; and Balaam’s anger was kindled, and he smote the ass with a staff.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the LORD opened the mouth of the ass, and she said unto Balaam, What have I done unto thee that thou hast smitten me these three times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said unto the ass, Because thou hast mocked me. I wish there were a sword in my hand, for now would I kill thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ass said unto Balaam, Am I not thine ass upon which thou hast ridden ever since I was thine unto this day? Was I ever accustomed to do so unto thee? And he said, No.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the LORD opened the eyes of Balaam, and he saw the angel of the LORD standing in the way and his sword drawn in his hand; and he bowed down his head and fell flat on his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the LORD said unto him, Why hast thou smitten thine ass these three times? Behold, I went out as thine adversary, because thy way is perverse before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ass saw me and turned from me these three times; and if she had not turned from me, I also now would slay thee and leave her alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam said unto the angel of the LORD, I have sinned; for I did not know that thou didst stand in the way against me; now therefore, if it displease thee, I will return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the angel of the LORD said unto Balaam, Go with the men; but only the word that I shall speak unto thee, that thou shalt speak. So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Balak heard that Balaam was come, he went out to meet him unto a city of Moab, which is next to the border of Arnon, which is at the limit of his territory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said unto Balaam, Did I not earnestly send unto thee to call thee? Why hast thou not come unto me? Am I not able indeed to promote thee to honour?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Behold, I am come unto thee; may I now say something? The word that God puts in my mouth, that shall I speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam went with Balak, and they came unto Kirjathhuzoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak killed oxen and sheep and sent to Balaam and to the princes that were with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the next day, Balak took Balaam and brought him up into the high places of Baal, and from there he saw the utmost part of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars and prepare me here seven oxen and seven rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bullock and a ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Stand by thy burnt offering, and I will go; peradventure the LORD will come to meet me, and whatever he shows me I will tell thee. And thus he went alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God met Balaam; and he said unto him, I have prepared seven altars, and I have offered upon each altar a bullock and a ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD put a word in Balaam’s mouth and said, Return unto Balak, and thus thou shalt speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he returned unto him, and, behold, he stood by his burnt sacrifice, he and all the princes of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took up his parable and said, Balak, the king of Moab, has brought me from Aram, out of the mountains of the east, saying, Come, curse me Jacob and come, denounce Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should I curse one whom God has not cursed? And why should I denounce one whom the LORD has not denounced?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For from the top of the rocks I have seen him, and from the hills I beheld him; behold, a people that shall dwell in confidence and shall not be counted among the Gentiles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who shall count the dust of Jacob and the number of the fourth part of Israel? Let my soul die the death of the righteous, and let my last end be like his!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said unto Balaam, What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse my enemies, and, behold, thou hast blessed them altogether.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he answered and said, Must I not take heed to speak that which the LORD has put in my mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said unto him, Come, I pray thee, with me unto another place, from which thou may see them; thou hast seen but the utmost part of them and hast not seen them all; and from there thou shalt curse them for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought him into the field of Zophim to the top of Pisgah and built seven altars and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said unto Balak, Stand here by thy burnt offering, while I meet the LORD yonder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD met Balaam and put a word in his mouth and said unto him, Go again unto Balak and say thus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he came unto him, and behold, he stood by his burnt offering and the princes of Moab with him. And Balak said unto him, What has the LORD spoken?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took up his parable and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent; he said and shall he not do it? He spoke and shall he not execute it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have received blessing; and he has blessed; and I cannot reverse it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has not beheld iniquity in Jacob, neither has he seen rebellion in Israel; the LORD his God is with him, and the battle-cry of a king is in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God brought them out of Egypt; he has, as it were the strength of a unicorn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because there is no enchantment in Jacob, neither is there any divination in Israel. According to this time, it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What God has made!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold the people, who shall rise up as a great lion and lift up himself as a young lion; he shall not lie down until he eats of the prey and drinks the blood of the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak said unto Balaam, Now that you do not curse them, do not bless them either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam said unto Balak, Did I not tell thee that all that the LORD says unto me, that I must do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak said unto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place; peradventure it will please God that thou may curse them for me from there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looks toward Jeshimon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balak did as Balaam had said and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Balaam saw that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, he did not go, as the first and second times, to seek for enchantments, but he set his face toward the wilderness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lifting up his eyes, he saw Israel abiding in his tents according to their tribes; and the Spirit of God came upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took up his parable and said, Balaam, the son of Beor, has said and the man whose eyes are open has said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he who has heard the words of God has said, who saw the vision of the Almighty, fallen, but having his eyes open:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How beautiful are thy tents, O Jacob, and thy habitations, O Israel!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the valleys are they spread forth, as gardens by the river’s side, as the trees of lign aloes which the LORD has planted, and as cedars beside the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From his branches he shall distil waters, and his seed shall be in many waters, and his king shall be higher than Agag, and his kingdom shall be exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God brought him forth out of Egypt; he has, as it were, the strength of a unicorn; he shall eat up the Gentiles his enemies and shall break their bones and pierce them through with his arrows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He couched, he lay down as a lion and as a great lion; who shall awaken him? Blessed is he that blesses thee, and cursed is he that curses thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balak’s anger was kindled against Balaam, and smiting his hands together he said, I called thee to curse my enemies, and, behold, thou hast altogether blessed them these three times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, now flee thou to thy place; I said that I would honour thee; but, behold, the LORD has deprived thee of honour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Balaam replied unto Balak, Did I not declare also unto thy messengers which thou didst send unto me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the commandment of the LORD, to do either good or bad of my own heart; but what the LORD saith that will I speak?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, behold, I go now unto my people; come and I will indicate unto thee what this people shall do to thy people in the latter days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took up his parable and said, Balaam, the son of Beor, has said, the man whose eyes are open has said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he who has heard the words of God has said, and he who knows the knowledge of the most High, he who saw the vision of the Almighty, fallen, but having his eyes open:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I shall see him, but not now; I shall behold him, but not near by; there shall come a Star out of Jacob, and a Sceptre shall rise out of Israel and shall smite the corners of Moab and destroy all the sons of Seth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Edom shall be taken; Seir also shall be taken by his enemies; and Israel shall do valiantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of Jacob shall come he that shall have dominion and shall destroy what remains of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he looked on Amalek, he took up his parable, and said, Amalek, head of the Gentiles; but his latter end shall be that he perish for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he looked on the Kenite and took up his parable and said, Strong is thy dwelling place, and thou puttest thy nest in a rock;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the Kenite shall be thrown out, when Asshur shall carry thee away captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took up his parable again and said, Alas, who shall live when God shall do these things!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ships shall come from the coast of Chittim and shall afflict Asshur and shall afflict Eber, but he also shall perish for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Balaam rose up and went and returned to his place; and Balak also went his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel abode in Shittim, and the people began to fornicate with the daughters of Moab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who called the people unto the sacrifices of their gods; and the people ate and bowed down to their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Israel joined himself unto Baalpeor; and the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take all the princes of the people and disjoint them before the LORD hanging them from a tree against the sun, that the fierce anger of the LORD may be turned away from Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said unto the judges of Israel, Slay ye every one his men that were joined unto Baalpeor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, behold, one of the sons of Israel came and brought unto his brethren a Midianite woman in the sight of Moses and in the sight of all the congregation of the sons of Israel, who were weeping before the door of the tabernacle of the testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saw it, he rose up from among the congregation and took a javelin in his hand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he went after the man of Israel into the tent and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel and the woman through her belly. So the plague of the sons of Israel was stayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those that died in that plague were twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned my wrath away from the sons of Israel, being zealous for my sake among them, therefore I did not consume the sons of Israel in my jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of this say unto them, Behold, I establish my covenant of peace with him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he shall have, and his seed after him, even the covenant of the everlasting priesthood because he was zealous for his God and reconciled the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the name of the Israelite that was slain, even that was slain with the Midianite, was Zimri, the son of Salu, a prince of a family of the tribe of Simeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the Midianite woman that was slain was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur, prince of peoples, of the house of the father, in Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Declare war on the Midianites and smite them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for they treated you as enemies with their wiles, with which they have beguiled you in the matter of Peor, and in the matter of Cozbi, daughter of the prince of Midian, their sister, who was slain in the day of the plague for Peor’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came to pass after the plague that the LORD spoke unto Moses and unto Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the sum of all the congregation of the sons of Israel, from twenty years old and upward, by the houses of their fathers, all that are able to go to war in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar, the priest, spoke with them in the plains of Moab by the Jordan of Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Count the people from twenty years old and upward as the LORD commanded Moses and the sons of Israel, who went forth out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reuben, firstborn of Israel; the sons of Reuben: Enoch, of whom was the family of the Enochites; of Pallu, the family of the Palluites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the family of the Carmites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Reubenites; and those numbered were forty-three thousand seven hundred and thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Pallu: Eliab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Eliab: Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. This is that Dathan and Abiram, who were famous in the congregation, who strove against Moses and against Aaron in the company of Korah, when they strove against the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the earth opened her mouth and swallowed them up together with Korah, when that company died, when the fire devoured two hundred and fifty men and they became an example.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding the sons of Korah did not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Simeon by their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites; of Saul, the family of the Shaulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Simeonites, twenty-two thousand two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad by their families: of Zephon, the family of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the family of the Haggites; of Shuni, the family of the Shunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Ozni, the family of the Oznites; of Eri, the family of the Erites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Arod, the family of the Arodites; of Areli, the family of the Arelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Gad according to those numbered, forty thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah: Er and Onan; and Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Judah by their families: of Shelah, the family of the Shelanites; of Pharez, the family of the Pharzites; of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Pharez: of Hezron, the family of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the family of the Hamulites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Judah according to those numbered, seventy-six thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Issachar by their families: of Tola, the family of the Tolaites; of Pua, the family of the Punites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Issachar according to those numbered, sixty-four thousand three hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Zebulun after their families: of Sered, the family of the Sardites; of Elon, the family of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the family of the Jahleelites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Zebulunites according to those numbered, sixty thousand five hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator
