verses.text: The sons of Joseph by their families: Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Manasseh: of Machir, the family of the Machirites; and Machir begat Gilead; of Gilead comes the family of the Gileadites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Gilead: of Jeezer, the family of the Jeezerites; of Helek, the family of the Helekites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Asriel, the family of the Asrielites; of Shechem, the family of the Shechemites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Shemida, the family of the Shemidaites; and of Hepher, the family of the Hepherites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, had no sons, but daughters; and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Manasseh, and those numbered of them, fifty-two thousand seven hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ephraim by their families: of Shuthelah, the family of the Shuthalhites; of Becher, the family of the Bachrites; of Tahan, the family of the Tahanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are the sons of Shuthelah: of Eran, the family of the Eranites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Ephraim according to those numbered, thirty-two thousand five hundred. These are the sons of Joseph by their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Benjamin after their families: of Bela, the family of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the family of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the family of the Ahiramites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Shupham, the family of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the family of the Huphamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard, the family of the Ardites; and of Naaman, the family of the Naamites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Benjamin by their families: and those numbered were forty-five thousand six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Dan by their families: of Shuham, the family of the Shuhamites. These are the families of Dan by their families.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the families of the Shuhamites, according to those numbered, were sixty-four thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Asher after their families: of Jimna, the family of the Jimnites; of Jesui, the family of the Jesuites; of Beriah, the family of the Beriites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Beriah: of Heber, the family of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the family of the Malchielites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Sarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the sons of Asher according to those numbered; fifty-three thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Naphtali by their families: of Jahzeel, the family of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the family of the Gunites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of Jezer, the family of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the family of the Shillemites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of Naphtali by their families; and those numbered were forty-five thousand four hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the numbered of the sons of Israel, six hundred and one thousand seven hundred and thirty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unto these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To those that are many thou shalt give more inheritance, and to those that are few thou shalt give less inheritance; to each one shall his inheritance be given according to those that were numbered of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Notwithstanding the land shall be divided by lot; according to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to the lot shall the inheritance be divided between those that are many and those that are few.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are those that were numbered of the Levites by their families: of Gershon, the family of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the family of the Kohathites; of Merari, the family of the Merarites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the families of the Levites: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korathites. And Kohath begat Amram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed, daughter of Levi, whom her mother bore to Levi in Egypt: and she bore unto Amram Aaron and Moses and Miriam, their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And unto Aaron was born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Nadab and Abihu died when they offered strange fire before the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those that were numbered of them were twenty-three thousand, all males from a month old and upward; for they were not numbered among the sons of Israel because no inheritance was to be given them among the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are those that were numbered by Moses and Eleazar, the priest, who numbered the sons of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And among these there was not a man of those whom Moses and Aaron the priest had numbered when they numbered the sons of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the LORD had said of them, They shall surely die in the wilderness. And there was not left a man of them, except Caleb, the son of Jephunneh and Joshua, the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of Manasseh, the son of Joseph; and these are the names of his daughters; Mahlah, Noah and Hoglah and Milcah and Tirzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they stood before Moses and before Eleazar, the priest, and before the princes and all the congregation, by the door of the tabernacle of the testimony, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our father died in the wilderness, and he was not in the company of those that gathered themselves together against the LORD in the company of Korah, but died in his own sin, and had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should the name of our father be done away from among his family because he has no son? Give unto us therefore a possession among the brethren of our father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses brought their cause before the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The daughters of Zelophehad speak right; thou shalt surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father’s brethren, and thou shalt cause the inheritance of their father to pass unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt speak unto the sons of Israel, saying, If a man dies and has no son, then ye shall cause his inheritance to pass unto his daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he has no daughter, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he has no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his father’s brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if his father has no brethren, then ye shall give his inheritance unto his kinsman that is next to him of his lineage, and he shall inherit it; and it shall be unto the sons of Israel a law of rights, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Climb up this Mount Abarim, and thou shalt see the land which I have given unto the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after thou hast seen it, thou also shalt be gathered unto thy peoples, as Aaron thy brother was gathered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye were rebels to my word in the desert of Zin, in the strife of the congregation, to sanctify me in the waters before their eyes. These are the waters of Meribah of Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses spoke unto the LORD, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the LORD, the God of the spirits of all flesh, set a man over the congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who may go out before them, and who may go in before them, and who may lead them out and who may bring them in that the congregation of the LORD not be as sheep without a shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Take Joshua, the son of Nun, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay thine hand upon him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and set him before Eleazar, the priest, and before all the congregation and give him a charge in their presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt put some of thy splendour upon him that all the congregation of the sons of Israel may hear him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall stand before Eleazar, the priest, whom he shall consult in the judgment of the Urim before the LORD; at his word shall they go out, and at his word they shall come in, both he and all the sons of Israel with him, even all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses did as the LORD commanded him, and he took Joshua and set him before Eleazar, the priest, and before all the congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he laid his hands upon him and gave him a charge, as the LORD had commanded by the hand of Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the sons of Israel and say unto them, My offering, my bread with my offerings on fire, for an acceptable savour unto me, shall ye observe to offer unto me in their due season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thou shalt say unto them, This is the offering on fire which ye shall offer unto the LORD; two lambs of the first year without spot each day, for a continual burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning, and the other lamb shalt thou offer between the two evenings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a tenth part of an ephah of flour, mingled with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil as a present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a continual burnt offering, which was ordained in Mount Sinai for an acceptable savour, an offering on fire unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the drink offering thereof shall be the fourth part of a hin with each lamb; thou shalt pour out the drink offering of superior wine unto the LORD in the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the other lamb shalt thou offer between the two evenings; according to the offering of the morning and according to the drink offering thereof, thou shalt offer it, an offering on fire, of an acceptable savour unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the sabbath day two lambs of the first year without spot and two tenth deals of flour mingled with oil, for a present, with the drink offering thereof:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the burnt offering of the sabbath, besides the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the beginnings of your months ye shall offer a burnt offering unto the LORD: two young bullocks, and one ram, seven lambs of the first year without spot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and three tenth deals of flour mingled with oil, as a present with each bullock; and two tenth deals of flour mingled with oil, as a present with each ram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and a tenth deal of flour mingled with oil in offering as a present with each lamb; a burnt offering of an acceptable savour, a sacrifice on fire unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine with each bullock and the third part of a hin with each ram and a fourth part of a hin with each lamb. This shall be the burnt offering of each month throughout all the months of the year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one he goat as the sin shall be offered unto the LORD, besides the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the fourteenth of the first month shall be the passover of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the fifteenth day of this month is the feast; seven days shall unleavened bread be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first day shall be a holy convocation; ye shall do no manner of servile work therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall offer a sacrifice on fire for a burnt offering unto the LORD: two young bullocks and one ram and seven lambs of the first year; they shall be unto you without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their present shall be of flour mingled with oil; three tenth deals shall ye offer with each bullock and two tenth deals with each ram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a tenth deal shalt thou offer with each of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat as the sin, to reconcile you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall offer these besides the burnt offering in the morning, which is the continual burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this manner ye shall offer daily throughout the seven days, the bread of the sacrifice on fire, of an acceptable savour unto the LORD; it shall be offered besides the continual burnt offering and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the seventh day ye shall have a holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also in the day of the firstfruits, when ye offer a new present unto the LORD in your fulfilled weeks, ye shall have a holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But ye shall offer in burnt offering, in an acceptable savour unto the LORD: two young bullocks, one ram, seven lambs of the first year;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their present of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals with each bullock, two tenth deals with each ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a tenth deal with each of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat, to reconcile you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall offer them besides the continual burnt offering and its presents and their drink offerings; they shall be unto you without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the seventh month, on the first day of the month, ye shall have a holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work; it is a day of sounding an alarm unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall offer a burnt offering for an acceptable savour unto the LORD: one young bullock, one ram, and seven lambs of the first year without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their present shall be of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals with each bullock, and two tenth deals with each ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth deal with each of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat as the sin, to reconcile you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides the burnt offering of the month and its present, and the daily burnt offering and its present and their drink offerings, according to their law, for an acceptable savour, a sacrifice on fire unto the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall have on the tenth of this seventh month a holy convocation; and ye shall afflict your souls; ye shall not do any work;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye shall offer in burnt offering unto the LORD for an acceptable savour: one young bullock, one ram, and seven lambs of the first year; they shall be unto you without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their presents shall be of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals with each bullock, and two tenth deals with each ram,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a tenth deal for each of the seven lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one he goat as the sin, besides the offering of the reconciliations for the sin, and the continual burnt offering and its presents and their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also on the fifteenth day of the seventh month ye shall have a holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work, and ye shall keep a feast unto the LORD seven days;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye shall offer in burnt offering, a sacrifice on fire, of an acceptable savour unto the LORD: thirteen young bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year; they shall be without blemish
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their presents of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals with each of the thirteen bullocks, two tenth deals with each of the two rams,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one tenth deal with each of the fourteen lambs;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat as the sin, besides the continual burnt offering, its present, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the second day ye shall offer twelve young bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without spot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their presents and their drink offerings with the bullocks, with the rams, and with the lambs shall be according to their number, according to the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one he goat as the sin, besides the continual burnt offering and its present and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the third day eleven bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their presents and their drink offerings with the bullocks, with the rams, and with the lambs shall be according to their number, according to the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat as the sin, besides the continual burnt offering and its present and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the fourth day ten bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their presents and their drink offerings with the bullocks, with the rams, and with the lambs shall be according to their number, according to the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat as the sin, besides the continual burnt offering, its present, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the fifth day nine bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without spot;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their presents and their drink offerings with the bullocks, with the rams, and with the lambs shall be according to their number, according to the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat as the sin, besides the continual burnt offering, and its present, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the sixth day eight bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their presents and their drink offerings with the bullocks, with the rams, and with the lambs shall be according to their number, according to the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat as the sin, besides the continual burnt offering, its present, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And on the seventh day seven bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs of the first year without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their presents and their drink offerings with the bullocks, with the rams, and with the lambs shall be according to their number, according to the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat as the sin, besides the continual burnt offering, its present, and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the eighth day ye shall have a solemn assembly; ye shall do no servile work:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall offer in burnt offering, in a sacrifice on fire, of an acceptable savour unto the LORD one bullock, one ram, seven lambs of the first year without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their presents and their drink offerings with the bullock, with the ram, and with the lambs shall be according to their number, according to the law;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one he goat as the sin, besides the continual burnt offering and its present and its drink offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things ye shall offer unto the LORD in your solemnities, besides your vows, and your freewill offerings, in your burnt offerings, and in your presents, and in your drink offerings, and in your peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses told the sons of Israel according to all that the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses spoke unto the princes of the tribes concerning the sons of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the LORD has commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a man vows a vow unto the LORD or swears an oath to bind his soul with a bond, he shall not defile his word: he shall do according to all that proceeded out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the woman, when she shall vow a vow unto the LORD and bind herself by a bond, being in her father’s house in her youth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her father hears her vow and her bond with which she has bound her soul, and her father shall remain silent regarding it, then all her promises shall stand, and every bond with which she has bound her soul shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her father disallows her in the day that he hears all of her vows and of her bonds with which she has bound her soul, they shall not stand, and the LORD shall forgive her, because her father disallowed her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if she had at all a husband when she vowed or pronounced anything out of her lips, with which she bound her soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if her husband heard it and remained silent regarding it in the day that he heard it, then her vows shall stand, and her bonds with which she bound her soul shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband disallowed her on the day that he heard it, then her vow which she vowed and that which she pronounced with her lips, with which she bound her soul, shall be of no effect, and the LORD shall forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every vow of a widow and of her that is divorced, with which they have bound their souls, shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if she vowed in her husband’s house or bound her soul by a bond with an oath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if her husband heard it and remained silent regarding it and did not disallow her, then all her vows shall stand, and every bond with which she bound her soul shall stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband has utterly made them void on the day he heard them, then whatever proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows or concerning the bond of her soul, shall not stand; her husband has made them void, and the LORD shall forgive her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every vow and every binding oath to afflict the soul, her husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if her husband remained silent regarding this from day to day; then he establishes all her vows or all her bonds, which are upon her; he confirms them because he remained silent regarding this in the day that he heard them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he shall in any way make them void after that he has heard them, then he shall bear her iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the statutes which the LORD commanded Moses between a man and his wife and between the father and his daughter, being yet in her youth in her father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Avenge the sons of Israel upon the Midianites; afterward thou shalt be gathered unto thy peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses spoke unto the people, saying, Arm some of yourselves unto the war and let them go against the Midianites and carry out the vengeance of the LORD in Midian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A thousand out of every tribe throughout all the tribes of Israel shall ye send to the war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there were delivered out of the thousands of Israel a thousand of every tribe, twelve thousand armed for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses sent them to the war; he sent a thousand of every tribe; and Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest, went to the war with the holy instruments, with the trumpets to blow in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they fought against the Midianites as the LORD commanded Moses; and they slew all the males.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they also slew the kings of Midian among the rest of those that were slain: namely, Evi and Rekem and Zur and Hur and Reba, five kings of Midian; they also slew Balaam, the son of Beor, with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel took all the women of Midian captives and their little ones and took the spoil of all their beasts and all their flocks and all their goods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they burnt all their cities in which they dwelt and all their palaces with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took all the spoil and all the prey, both of men and of beasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they brought the captives and the prey and the spoil unto Moses and Eleazar, the priest, and unto the congregation of the sons of Israel, unto the camp in the plains of Moab, which was by Jordan of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar, the priest, and all the princes of the congregation went forth to meet them outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses was angry with the officers of the host, with the captains over thousands and captains over hundreds who returned from the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto them, Have ye saved all the women alive?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, these caused the sons of Israel through the counsel of Balaam to commit trespass against the LORD in the matter of Peor for which there was a plague among the congregation of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore kill every male among the little ones and kill every woman that has known a man by lying with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all the female children that have not known a man by lying with him keep alive for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye must abide outside the camp seven days; and whoever has killed any person and whoever has touched any dead body ye shall remove the sin from them on the third and on the seventh day, both of yourselves and of your captives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise remove all sin from all your clothing and all that is made of skins and all work of goats’ hair and every vessel made of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Eleazar, the priest, said unto the men of war which went to the battle, This is the ordinance of the law which the LORD commanded Moses;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: certainly the gold and the silver, the brass, the iron, the tin, and the lead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: every thing that may endure the fire, ye shall cause to pass through the fire, and it shall be clean; nevertheless, ye shall remove the sin with the water of separation; and all that does not endure the fire ye shall cause to go through the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall also wash your clothes on the seventh day, and ye shall be clean, and afterwards ye shall come into the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take the sum of the prey that was taken, both of man and of beast, thou and Eleazar, the priest, and the heads of the fathers of the congregation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and divide the prey into two parts between those that took the part in the war, who went out to battle, and all the congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And offer a tribute unto the LORD from the men of war who went out to battle: one soul of five hundred, both of the persons and of the oxen and of the asses and of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take it from their half and give Eleazar, the priest, the offering of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the half belonging to the sons of Israel, thou shalt take one portion of fifty, of the persons, of the oxen, of the asses, and of the flocks, of all manner of animals and give them unto the Levites, who keep the charge of the tabernacle of the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar, the priest, did as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the prey, that is the rest of the prey which the men of war had caught, was six hundred and seventy-five thousand sheep
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and seventy-two thousand oxen
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sixty-one thousand asses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thirty-two thousand persons in all, of women that had not known a man by lying with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the half which was the portion of those that went out to war was in number three hundred and thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the tribute for the LORD, of the sheep was six hundred and seventy-five.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the oxen were thirty-six thousand, of which the tribute for the LORD was seventy-two.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the asses were thirty thousand five hundred, of which the tribute for the LORD was sixty-one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the persons were sixteen thousand, of which the tribute for the LORD was thirty-two persons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave the tribute, which was the LORD’s heave offering, unto Eleazar, the priest, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the half pertaining to the sons of Israel, which Moses divided from the men that had gone to war,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (now the half that pertained unto the congregation was three hundred and thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thirty-six thousand oxen
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and thirty thousand five hundred asses
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and sixteen thousand persons)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of the half, therefore of the sons of Israel, Moses took one portion of fifty, both of man and of beast, and gave them unto the Levites, who kept the charge of the tabernacle of the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the officers who were over thousands of the host, the captains of thousands and captains of hundreds, came near unto Moses,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said unto Moses, Thy slaves have taken the sum of the men of war who are under our charge and not one man of us is missing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have therefore brought an offering for the LORD, each man of what he has found, of vessels of gold, chains, and bracelets, rings, earrings, and tablets, to reconcile our souls before the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar, the priest, took the gold from them, all wrought vessels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the gold of the offering that they offered up to the LORD, of the captains of thousands and of the captains of hundreds, was sixteen thousand seven hundred and fifty shekels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For the men of war had taken spoil, every man for himself.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses and Eleazar, the priest, took the gold from the captains of thousands and of hundreds and brought it into the tabernacle of the testimony, for a memorial of the sons of Israel before the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad had a very great multitude of livestock, and when they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead, it seemed unto them that the place was a place for livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben came and spoke unto Moses and to Eleazar, the priest, and unto the princes of the congregation, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ataroth and Dibon and Jazer and Nimrah and Heshbon and Elealeh and Shebam and Nebo and Beon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the country which the LORD smote before the congregation of Israel, is a land for livestock, and thy slaves have livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, they said, if we have found grace in thy sight, let this land be given unto thy slaves for a possession and do not make us pass the Jordan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto the sons of Gad and to the sons of Reuben, Shall your brethren go to war, and shall ye sit here?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do ye discourage the heart of the sons of Israel from going over into the land which the LORD has given them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus did your fathers when I sent them from Kadeshbarnea to see the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they went up unto the valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the sons of Israel that they should not go into the land which the LORD had given them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD’s anger was kindled the same time, and he swore, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely none of the men that came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I swore unto Abraham, unto Isaac, and unto Jacob; because they were not perfect in following me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: except Caleb, the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite, and Joshua, the son of Nun, for they were perfect in following the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD’s anger was kindled against Israel, and he made them wander in the wilderness forty years until all the generation that had done evil in the sight of the LORD was consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And, behold, ye are risen up in the place of your fathers, an increase of sinful men, to augment yet the fierce anger of the LORD toward Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if ye turn away from after him, he will yet again leave you in the wilderness; and ye shall destroy all this people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they came near unto him and said, We will build sheepfolds here for our livestock and cities for our little ones,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we ourselves will go arm ourselves and go with diligence before the sons of Israel until we have brought them unto their place, and our little ones shall dwell in the fenced cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will not return unto our houses until the sons of Israel have inherited each man his inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we will not inherit with them on the other side of the Jordan or forward because our inheritance is fallen to us on this side of Jordan eastward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses said unto them, If ye will do this thing, if ye will prepare yourselves to go before the LORD to the war
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will all pass the Jordan armed before the LORD until he has driven out his enemies from before him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the land is subdued before the LORD, then afterward ye shall return and be guiltless before the LORD and before Israel, and this land shall be your possession before the LORD.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye will not do so, behold, ye shall have sinned against the LORD, and be sure your sin will catch up with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Build cities for your little ones and folds for your sheep and do that which has proceeded out of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben spoke unto Moses, saying, Thy slaves will do as my lord commands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our little ones, our wives, our livestock, and all our beasts, shall be there in the cities of Gilead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but thy slaves, each one armed for war, will pass before the LORD to battle, as our lord saith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So concerning them Moses commanded Eleazar, the priest, and Joshua, the son of Nun, and the princes of the fathers of the tribes of the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses said unto them, If the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben will pass the Jordan with you, each one armed to battle, before the LORD, after the land shall be subdued before you, then ye shall give them the land of Gilead for a possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if they will not pass over with you armed, they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben answered, saying, As the LORD has said unto thy slaves, so will we do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will pass over armed before the LORD into the land of Canaan, and the possession of our inheritance on this side of the Jordan shall be ours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Moses gave unto the sons of Gad and to the sons of Reuben and unto half the tribe of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land, with its cities and borders, even the cities of the country round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Gad built Dibon and Ataroth and Aroer
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Atroth-shophan and Jaazer and Jogbehah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Bethnimrah and Bethharan, fenced cities, and also folds for sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Reuben built Heshbon and Elealeh and Kirjathaim
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Nebo and Baalmeon (their names being changed) and Shibmah and gave other names unto the cities which they built.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Machir, the son of Manasseh, went to Gilead and took it and dispossessed the Amorite who was in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses gave Gilead unto Machir, the son of Manasseh; and he dwelt therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jair, the son of Manasseh also went and took the small towns thereof and called them Havothjair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise Nobah went and took Kenath and its villages and called it Nobah, after his own name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the journeys of the sons of Israel who went forth out of the land of Egypt with their hosts under the hand of Moses and Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses wrote their goings out according to their journeys by the commandment of the LORD. These are their journeys according to their goings out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month; on the second day of the passover the sons of Israel went out with a high hand in the sight of all the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, which the LORD had smitten among them, the LORD having also executed judgments upon their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sons of Israel removed from Rameses and pitched in Succoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Succoth and pitched in Etham, which is in the edge of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Etham and turned again unto Pihahiroth, which is before Baalzephon, and they pitched before Migdol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from before Pihahiroth and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness and went three days’ journey in the wilderness of Etham and pitched in Marah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Marah and came unto Elim, and in Elim were twelve fountains of water and seventy palm trees, and they pitched there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Elim and encamped by the Red Sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from the Red Sea and encamped in the wilderness of Sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they took their journey out of the wilderness of Sin and encamped in Dophkah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Dophkah and encamped in Alush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Alush and encamped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Rephidim and pitched in the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from the desert of Sinai and pitched at Kibrothhattaavah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Kibrothhattaavah and encamped at Hazeroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Hazeroth and pitched in Rithmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Rithmah and pitched at Rimmonparez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Rimmonparez and pitched in Libnah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Libnah and pitched at Rissah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they journeyed from Rissah and pitched in Kehelathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went from Kehelathah and pitched in Mount Shapher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Mount Shapher and encamped in Haradah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Haradah and pitched in Makheloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Makheloth and encamped at Tahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Tahath and pitched at Tarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Tarah and pitched in Mithcah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went from Mithcah and pitched in Hashmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Hashmonah and encamped at Moseroth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Moseroth and pitched in Benejaakan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Benejaakan and encamped at Horhagidgad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went from Horhagidgad and pitched in Jotbathah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Jotbathah and encamped at Ebronah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Ebronah and encamped at Eziongaber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Eziongaber and pitched in the wilderness of Zin, which is Kadesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Kadesh and pitched in Mount Hor, in the edge of the land of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron, the priest, went up into Mount Hor at the commandment of the LORD and died there in the fortieth year, after the sons of Israel were come out of the land of Egypt, in the first day of the fifth month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Aaron was one hundred and twenty-three years old when he died in Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And King Arad, the Canaanite, who dwelt in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard how the sons of Israel had come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Mount Hor and pitched in Zalmonah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Zalmonah and pitched in Punon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Punon and pitched in Oboth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Oboth and pitched in Ijeabarim, in the border of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from Iim and pitched in Dibongad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Dibongad and encamped in Almondiblathaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they removed from Almondiblathaim and pitched in the mountains of Abarim, before Nebo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they departed from the mountains of Abarim and pitched in the plains of Moab by Jordan of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally they pitched by the Jordan, from Bethjesimoth even unto Abelshittim in the plains of Moab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan of Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the sons of Israel and say unto them, When ye have passed the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then ye shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land from before you and abolish all their paintings and abolish all their molten images and destroy all their high places,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and ye shall dispossess the inhabitants of the land and dwell therein; for I have given you the land to inherit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall inherit the land by lots by your families, and to those with the most ye shall give more inheritance, and to the fewer ye shall give less inheritance, each one’s inheritance shall be in the place where his lot falls; according to the tribes of your fathers ye shall inherit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if ye will not drive out the inhabitants of the land from before you, then it shall come to pass that those whom ye let remain of them shall be pricks in your eyes and thorns in your sides and shall afflict you in the land in which ye dwell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover it shall come to pass that I shall do unto you, as I thought to do unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the sons of Israel and say unto them, When ye have entered into the land of Canaan (this is the land that shall fall unto you for an inheritance, even the land of Canaan according to its borders),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: you shall have on the side of the Negev from the wilderness of Zin unto the borders of Edom, and your border towards the Negev shall be the outmost coast of the salt sea eastward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this border shall turn from the Negev to the ascent of Akrabbim and pass on to Zin, and the going forth thereof shall be from the Negev to Kadeshbarnea and shall go on to Hazaraddar and pass on to Azmon;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the border shall fetch a compass from Azmon unto the river of Egypt, and the goings out of it shall be at the western sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for the western border, ye shall even have the great sea for a border; this shall be your west border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this shall be your north border: from the great sea ye shall point out for you Mount Hor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Mount Hor ye shall point out your border unto the entrance of Hamath, and the goings forth of the border shall be to Zedad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the border shall go on to Ziphron, and the goings out of it shall be at Hazarenan; this shall be your north border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall point out your east border from Hazarenan to Shepham,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain, and the border shall descend and shall reach unto the side of the sea of Chinnereth eastward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the border shall go down to the Jordan, and the goings out of it shall be at the salt sea; this shall be your land with the borders thereof round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses commanded the sons of Israel, saying, This is the land which ye shall inherit by lot, which the LORD commanded to give unto the nine tribes and to the half tribe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because the tribe of the sons of Reuben, according to the houses of their fathers, and the tribe of the sons of Gad, according to the houses of their fathers, and half the tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two tribes and the half tribe have received their inheritance on this side of the Jordan of Jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the men who shall divide the possession of the land for you: Eleazar, the priest, and Joshua, the son of Nun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall take one prince of every tribe to divide the possession of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the names of the men are these: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Simeon, Shemuel, the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad, the son of Chislon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the of the tribe of the sons of Dan, the prince Bukki, the son of Jogli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of the sons of Joseph: of the tribe of the sons of Manasseh, the prince Hanniel, the son of Ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Ephraim, the prince Kemuel, the son of Shiphtan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Zebulun, the prince Elizaphan, the son of Parnach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Issachar, the prince Paltiel, the son of Azzan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Asher, the prince Ahihud, the son of Shelomi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the tribe of the sons of Naphtali, the prince Pedahel, the son of Ammihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are those whom the LORD commanded to cause the sons of Israel to inherit the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan of Jericho, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Command the sons of Israel that they give unto the Levites of the inheritance of their possession cities to dwell in, and ye shall give also unto the Levites the suburbs of those cities round about them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall have the cities to dwell in; and the suburbs of them shall be for their animals and for their substance and for all their beasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the suburbs of the cities, which ye shall give unto the Levites, shall reach from the wall of the city and outward a thousand cubits round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then ye shall measure from outside the city on the east side two thousand cubits, and on the side of the Negev two thousand cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits; and the city shall be in the midst: this shall be to them the suburbs of the cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And among the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites, there shall be six cities for refuge, which ye shall appoint so that the manslayer may flee there; and in addition to them ye shall give them forty-two cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the cities which ye shall give to the Levites shall be forty-eight cities, the cities with their suburbs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the cities which ye shall give shall be of the possession of the sons of Israel; from those that have much ye shall give many; but from those that have few ye shall give few, each one shall give of his cities unto the Levites according to his possession which he inherited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the LORD spoke unto Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Speak unto the sons of Israel and say unto them, When ye have passed the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then ye shall appoint yourselves cities to be cities of refuge for you that the manslayer who kills any person unawares may flee there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall be unto you cities for refuge from the avenger {Heb. redeemer} that the manslayer not die until he stands before the congregation in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of these cities which ye shall give, six cities shall ye have for refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye shall give three cities on this side of the Jordan and three cities shall ye give in the land of Canaan, which shall be cities of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These six cities shall be a refuge, both for the sons of Israel and for the stranger and for the sojourner among them that anyone that kills another person unawares may flee there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he smites him with an instrument of iron so that he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he smites him by throwing a stone with which he may die, and he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if he smites him with a hand weapon of wood with which he may die, and he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kinsman avenger {Heb. redeemer} of blood shall slay the murderer; when he meets him, he shall slay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he thrusts him out of hatred or hurls at him by laying in wait, so that he dies
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or out of enmity smites him with his hand so that he dies, he that smote him shall surely be put to death; for he is a murderer; the kinsman avenger {Heb. redeemer} of blood shall slay the murderer when he meets him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he thrusts him suddenly without enmity, or has cast upon him any thing without laying in wait,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or with any stone, with which a man may die, seeing him not and casts it upon him that he dies, and was not his enemy, neither sought his harm,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the congregation shall judge between the slayer and the kinsman avenger {Heb. redeemer} of blood according to these laws.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the congregation shall deliver the manslayer out of the hand of the kinsman avenger {Heb. redeemer} of blood, and the congregation shall restore him to the city of his refuge, where he has fled, and he shall abide in it unto the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the manslayer shall at any time come outside the border of the city of his refuge where he has fled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the kinsman avenger {Heb. redeemer} of blood finds him outside the borders of the city of his refuge, and the kinsman avenger {Heb. redeemer} of blood slays the manslayer, he shall not be guilty of his blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He should have remained in the city of his refuge until the death of the high priest, but after the death of the high priest the manslayer shall return into the land of his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these things shall be for a statute of rights unto you throughout your ages in all your dwellings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever kills any person, the murderer shall be put to death by the mouth of witnesses, but one witness shall not testify against any person to cause him to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover ye shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death, but he shall be surely put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And ye shall take no ransom for him that is fled to the city of his refuge, that he should come again to dwell in the land, until the death of the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So ye shall not pollute the land where ye are, for this blood shall defile the land; and the land cannot be reconciled of the blood that is shed therein except by the blood of the one that shed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Defile not therefore the land which ye shall inhabit in the midst of which I dwell; for I the LORD dwell among the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the princes of the fathers of the families of the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near and spoke before Moses and before the princes, the heads of the fathers of the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said, The LORD commanded my lord to give the land for an inheritance by lot to the sons of Israel; and my lord was also commanded by the LORD to give the inheritance of Zelophehad, our brother unto his daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if they become married to any of the sons of the other tribes of the sons of Israel, then their inheritance shall be taken from the inheritance of our fathers and shall be put to the inheritance of the tribe unto which they are received; so shall it be taken from the lot of our inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the jubilee of the sons of Israel shall come, then shall their inheritance be put unto the inheritance of the tribe unto which they are received; so shall their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses commanded the sons of Israel according to the word of the LORD, saying, The tribe of the sons of Joseph has spoken well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the thing which the LORD commands concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, Let them marry as they desire; but they shall marry only within the family of the tribe of their father
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the inheritance of the sons of Israel shall not be passed from tribe to tribe; for each one of the sons of Israel shall cleave to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And any daughter, that possesses an inheritance in any tribe of the sons of Israel, shall marry one of the family of the tribe of her father so that each man of the sons of Israel may possess the inheritance of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that the inheritance shall not change from one tribe to another tribe, each one of the tribes of the sons of Israel shall cleave to his own inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the LORD commanded Moses, so did the daughters of Zelophehad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, married the sons of their uncles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were women of the family of the sons of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of the family of their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the commandments and the rights which the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses unto the sons of Israel in the plains of Moab by the Jordan of Jericho.
verses.speaker: Narrator
